reviews.title: Nice hotel....good breakfast!
reviews.text: After reviewing many hotels on this site, I ended up choosing the Metro for a 4 night trip to NYC with my mom and cousin. I mainly chose this for the location and for the fact that a breakfast was included. It was very nice to have the continental breakfast as an option in the mornings, and saved us from having to buy breakfast or coffee elsewhere. The 24 hr. coffee/tea service in the lobby was a nice touch as well.

The location of the hotel was awesome. It was a quick walk to the next block for both Macy's and the Empire State Bldg. We usually took a cab everywhere else because the weather was so cold while we were there. A cab ride to Times Square was about 6 dollars and approx. 5-10 minutes depending on traffic. Also about the same $ and time for a cab to any of the theatres.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location
Not as great as it used to be
reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was a good value by NYC standards. Our room happened to be a wheelchair-accessible room, so it was obviously larger than what the normal room size would be. Therefore, the three of us had plenty of space in a room with two double beds. I can't comment on the space issue in the average room. We were located (I think) on the back of the hotel, and there was no view at all from our window. But it didn't matter because we truly weren't in the room long enough anyway. Who wants to hang out in their hotel while in NYC??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did have a couple of minor problems with our room though that I should comment on. Our toilet continued to malfunction and we had to have maintenance there several times. Also the battery on our door lock started to "go dead" in the middle of the night (which resulted in a constant low beeping noise from 2 AM until we left the room at 9 AM). Apparently the front desk person was unable to change the battery and maintenance had to be contacted for this problem. This was a bit irritating to us, and the front desk wasn't very accomodating. Overall, the staff wasn't very helpful and/or friendly (with the exception of one bellman--an older gentleman and unfortunately I can't recall his name).
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So in summary, I would recommend this hotel for price, location, breakfast/coffee---but hopefully you won't have problems that require assistance from the front desk staff.
reviews.title: Some good & some bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed here 6th-10th july and loved this little hotel, its basic and clean and in an excellent location, the staff are very helpful the breakfast is good and the roof bar is amazing. would definately recommend this hotel
reviews.title: fab little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheapest place by far to book this hotel is through the BA Website.
reviews.title: Good Location and a little different

likes.liked: — Location, price and the Art Deco styling
likes.disliked: — The noise from the local construction work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location and only one block from the Empire State Building and two minutes from Maceys. We have just spent three nights there and found the Art Deco styling a pleasant change from the normal US hotel rooms. The continental breakfast is good with a choice of cereal, muffins, begels, toast, yogurt and fruit. Free tea and coffee are served all day which was a nice touch (although it meant no in-room facilities).
reviews.title: Noisy Construction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were efficient and polite although not over friendly apart from the doorman Mathew who was always smiling and very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Close to everything

reviews.text: If you like Chineses food the restaraunt a couple of doors along is reasonable and frequented predominently by oriental patrons (it's the one that does display the prices and is nearest to the hotel)
reviews.title: The Customer is Always Right?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights in Feb. 2007. We had a standard room, with a double bed, desk, two chairs, and a closet.
reviews.title: It's a fine place to stay - good value
Hotel Metro a real find
reviews.text: On the positive side, the room was average size for NYC. It was very clean. The bathroom was good sized, and the hot water worked well. The desk staff was friendly and helpful. They have a business center (2 computers) w/ printer and internet access, and they say they have hotel-wide wi-fi, but we didn't bring our computer to try. The complimentary continental breakfast was very convinient, if crowded. The hotel is short walking distance from the Empire State Building, Herald Square, Penn Station, and Madison Square Garden. TImes Square is only a slightly longer walk. For everything else, the hotel is very convenient to the subway - the station is at the end of the block. There are a couple of asian restaurants nearby, and a couple of irish pubs. The hotel bar makes an excellent cocktail.

reviews.title: Fantastic Location
reviews.text: On the down side, we experienced many of the problems mentioned in other traveler reviews. Our room was very hot, even with the heater off. It was around 20 degrees F outside during our stay, so we were able to sleep by cracking a window, but if it were just a few degrees warmer outside, it probably would have been unbearable. The room safe didn't work, so we had to take our valuables with us when we were out. The street noise was slightly distrubing (even when we had the window closed), even though we were at the back of the hotel and on the 12th floor. The elevators were incredibly slow, and while there was a person in uniform who was presumably the doorman, he did not open doors or assist with luggage. This would not have been a problem, except my wife is eight months pregnant and had trouble opening the door (it was REALLY windy) when I had the luggage. The guy just watched her struggle. Lastly, the touted rooftop terrace was closed for construction.

Anyhow, for the price, I suppose it is an OK hotel. There was nothing awful about our stay. However, there was nothing here to really make me want to come back. I will probably try a different hotel in this price range next time I'm in NYC.
reviews.title: Shopping & Tourist HEAVEN...I LOVED IT!!
Really pleased with the hotel!
reviews.text: A lovely stay. Kind people at the desk. A surprisingly nice continental breakfast. My room was quite large. As a single traveler I'm often given a closet. Small bathroom but perfectly nice. I'd stay here in a minute. As there was a lot of snow on the roof and repairs were underway, the amazing roof deck was closed. I peeked out and wasn't prepared for the stunning view of the Empire State Building! For the on-line price you can't beat it.

Chose Hotel Metro thanks to reviewers on this website. Couldn't fault it at all. Staff extremely helpful. 2nd floor room at back meant it was really quiet and we could walk upstairs. Free internet access. Excellent huge muffins and bagels/cereals/yoghurt for complimentary breakfast and all day tea and coffee/hot water provided free. Superb location one block from Empire State Building and Macys...short walk to Times Square and Broadway....extremely good value for money (we booked through BA as thats who we flew into NY wih). Highly recommended. I travelled with my teenage son and we had a twin room with 2 big very comfy beds. Metro Grill attached to hotel serves superb steak and fries and cheesecake and you get 10% discount if staying in the hotel. We walked to Central Park and hired bikes for $20 for 2 hours and managed to cycle round the whole thing.
reviews.title: Hotel Metro a real gem in NY

likes.liked: — free breakfast/internet/tea and coffee on tap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the hotel at the end of February for a week and I have to say it's great! The reason I chose it was because of the reviews I'd read here- so I just wanted to add my compliments.
reviews.title: Great experience overall

likes.disliked: — Not clear about their payment procedures

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, the best thing about this hotel is location, location, location. This was our first time in NYC, so we were really booking blind. It's within walking distance to most of the sights, and for those places a bit far away, there's a subway station less than a minute away. Macy's is a stone's throw away, and the Empire State Building is just around the corner- though you can see it from your room if you're feeling lazy!
reviews.title: Great find

reviews.text: Most of the staff were lovely, and very helpful with booking tours and giving advice and directions.
reviews.title: Staff was really helpful - nice continental breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is amazing- about 5 different types of bagels, breads, cheeses, fruit, cereal, muffins, juices, tea, coffee- it was really a great set up for the day. AND there's complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby throughout the day- fantastic!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: The hotel was lovely, the staff would do anything for you to make your stay enjoyable. They advise you on the top places to visit and eat. You could not fault the breakfast, there was fresh fruit, bread,buns, iced buns, cakes, cereal, yogurt, diced fruit, jam,marmalade,cheese,tea,coffee,pure orange juice,pure apple juice,milk,porridge and you could eat as much as you want in the dinning room or take up to your room. The rooms all had hair-dryers, iron + ironing boardsin as well as a safe + minibar,but try not using the mini bar, we went to the corner shop for the beer. The roof top was lovely sitting having a beer looking at the empirestate building.The only thing you need is a american travel plug whic we bought there + was @ £12.
reviews.title: Spot On

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to start with location. This is the best hotel i've ever seen with location and i've been in some good ones. Its a literal stonesthrow from Macys and a short walk from most places including the Empire State Building which we had a great view of from our room.
reviews.title: Awesome location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooftop also gives great views but in December is slightly too cold to hang about in!
reviews.title: Fantastic
Perfect Central Location
reviews.text: The rooms are quite small but very comfortable and well kept, plus if you shop around for hotels you'll find most New York hotels have the same thing "small rooms" because the space is such a premium.
Although expensive in most cities the Metro is very reasonable considering its NY and its got a great location.
reviews.title: Great Location!
Very Nice Staff at the Metro
reviews.text: We put up our family here when they visited during the Marathon. Everyone loved it, for reasons already mentioned - the free breakfast, great views from the roofterrace. But the biggest surprise for them was that the staff (including the housekeepers and the nice ladies in the breakfast area) were so friendly and helpful - also, my very particular mother-in-law said she had never stayed in a cleaner hotel, anywhere.

reviews.title: Perfect Location!!!!
reviews.text: This is a great hotel- perfect location. Tons of shopping and FREE BREAKFAST!!! Front desk extremely helpful. Enjoyed my stay and will definitely will come back (:

reviews.title: Excellent New York Experience!!
reviews.text: My experience at the Hotel Metro was awesome! Having stayed there in order to attend my sister's wedding, the location, atmosphere, & service was great. My family and I found the hotel to be very clean, comfortable, and what a fabulous continental breakfast they serve!!! I would definitely stay there again as well as recommend it to others looking to stay in a primo spot of New York City!
I stayed at the Hotel Metro last October and would like to recommend this very nice clean hotel again.
reviews.title: Looking for a nice hotel with many extras

reviews.text: It is an older hotel but it has a quaintness that is rare these days. It has a very convenient location within walking distance of the Empire State Bldg., the garment district but most of all
reviews.title: A Lovely Hotel
Good Location, Small Rooms
reviews.text: Dan H - Apple Valley MN

All the positives written about Hotel Metro in the previous postings are correct. With friendly helpful staff, great access to the subway, great shopping on your doorstep, tasty pizza at the end of the street, and a comfortable clean room there is little else that you would need!! Our room was facing the street and therefore we experienced a reasonable level of street noise, but that is NYC and we got used to it quickly.
reviews.title: Not new, but nice

reviews.title: Hotel Metro - a hidden gem

reviews.text: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend, and we got a good deal by paying in advance on ba.com.

reviews.text: The hotel's website makes it out to be posher than it actually is, but in terms of location it's superb - virtually opposite Macy's (I was there for shopping after all), very near Empire State Building and a very short walk from Times Square/5th avenue. We hardly took the subway at all. We got a deluxe room which was old fashioned but very spacious - only slight niggle was that the air con was noisy but this is typical of older hotels. Staff were not terribly friendly, and I was disappointed not to be able to get into my room until 5pm on the first day, despite my voucher stating clearly that check in was from 3pm.

after planning our trip for my 40th birthday with my best friend .i can safely
reviews.text: the hotel metro visited in july 2006.after planning this trip with my best friend to celebrate my 40th birthday,i was 100%happy with the hotel for many things firstly the location,the cleanliness of the entire hotel.staff were very helpful with any query you needed to know.we arrived at the hotel on the 8th of july at night.so the following morning we raced up to the roof terrace to which i was blown away at the sight of the empire state building,was pretty spectacular.at the end of the block was macys store and lots of other good shops.i would recommend the all loops tour which you can easily find their website and book on line for about 25 pound which i thought was the cheapest .took the staten island ferry which was free and takes about ten mins to cross,where you can get off and get back on again,the view of the statue of liberty is unreal as you sail by,the view of manhattan as you sail back is unreal loved it.celebrated my birthday on the tenth of july at one of the many restaurants in little italy,you can imagine the atmosphere as they had won the world cup.my friend and i enjoyed a meal with drinks for about 23 pounds well worth it.still cant believe that i have been to the big apple and if i have the opportunity to visit there again i would most definately stay at the metroi would just like to thank my best friend for making my birthday a one to remember as she booked everything i will never forget her that thank you terri of newcastle upon tyne thanks karen of wallsend tyne and wear x x x

We arrived at Penn Station after a flight to Newark and a train into the city. It's a four block walk to the hotel, between 5th and 6th Avenues. The lobby was small, but clean. The room had a view of the Empire State Building. It was a nice size with normal sized bathroom, no refrig or microwave. There's a rooftop public area and ice machine.
reviews.title: A Gem on 35th Street
Great Little hotel...great location
reviews.text: The first moring we went downstairs to the room off the lobby for a continental breakfast. It has the ususal muffins and bagels and fruit. The coffee and tea is available all hours. It was a bit crowded but we always found a seat for the 3 days we were there. It's perfect for a quick bite before tackling the sights.

But we found the main advantageof the hotel to be the location. It was about $250 a night including all those taxes,yet it was still a good deal. There's a restaurant next door and down the street, many delis and local small cafes. It's a short block to Macy's and two blocks to the Empire State Building. The subway is just a few steps away.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel & Location

reviews.text: Having been raised in NY, but moved to Az 30 years ago, I knew the city layout and used the subways a lot. You can get anywhere important to a tourist from this hotel in 30 minutes on the trains.
reviews.title: Fantastic Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from NYC. Went for weekend with a friend (in her 50's) and my boyfriend (both in our early 30's). It was our 5th time in the Big Apple. Drove there and parked the car at a Parking lot in the same block of the Hotel Metro. We stayed for 2 nights in the hotel family suite. Great staff, friendly. Room is a double room with one shared bathroom. One room is smaller with a door for more privacy, nice queen size bed and tv, 2 windows, small desk. Second room is a very large one with 2 double beds, tv, with a small table and nice cozy chair in a corner, one window. Everything was very clean. The bathroom is decent size, well equipped but bath is old and not emptying very fast....that is the only thing we did not like. Wireless internet working great. The breakfast is included , very yummy and runs until 11ham wich is great for people who do not like to get up too early. The roof terrace is real nice, with amazing view of the Empire State Building, great place to relax after a long day walking around NYC. Even if you are in the middle of Manhattan, the rooms are fairly quiet(you can hear once in a while a louder street noise but nothing to wake you up from your sleep). The 3 of us would definitely go back, price is worth it (we paid total of 960$ for 2 nights taxes inc. (Saturday and Sunday)Plus 50$ for parking for 48hours.) You could sleep comfortably 4 people or even 3 couples if you don't mind sharing one bathroom and if the hotel rules let you do that...not sure. I am glad we stayed there, it is a great choice for people who do not mind a little less luxury and a little more room. Pictures from hotel website can be trusted.
reviews.title: Great spot in the middle of NYC

reviews.text: So unlike most of these reviews my family and i did not have a nice stay at this hotel we only stayed one night,and thank god for that! we called the day before to see if we could have an early check in and they informed us that it would be ok. My daughter was graduating from college in the city at 6pm and we wanted time to get ready. we arrived at 12 and were told that our room would not be ready for another hour, so we did some shopping and came back in a hour then were told our room was still not ready so we proceeded to go get lunch becaseu we were told our room would defenitly be ready with in 15 min. when we returned with in an hour there was a new staff at the front desk that told us our room was still not ready, this women was so rude and arrogant that we just wanted to leave , but after waiting another 30 min we finally were put into our "penthouse" room where there were two bed that were small. we had five people that were staying over. when we called the front desk to ask for a cot we were informed that our penthouse suit was only for 2 people and that we were going to be charger 25$ extra a person. with that being said we thought that we could get a roll away bed, but no they had none! my daughters boyfriend had to end up sleeping on the ground. if this was not bad enough my daughter found dirty boxers under the bed!!!! i almost died when i saw this i was disgusted and mortified i am not one to complain about hotels and i am an easy going person along with my family but our stay here was just plan awful i would not go back and not recomend this hotel to anyone!!!!!!
reviews.title: awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our stay at the Hotel Metro, and were very pleased! We booked our room through Hotels.com, which usually gets you a smaller room with a double bed. However upon arrival, the friendly staff upgraded our room to the larger queen room in the back of the hotel, without us even asking! They were great at recommending restaurants and activities for our stay, and were overall very nice! The room was a good size, with good amenities within, and great toiletries. The bathroom is definitely on the small side, which made for interesting showers, as there really isn't anywhere to put your shampoo, conditioner, etc while in the shower! It wasn't a big problem though, as the rest of the room was just great. The breakfast is a major plus- it saved us a lot of money throughout our stay! There were yummy bagels, muffins, cinnamon toast, cereal, fruit, & juice. The breakfast goes until 11am, which works out great for those late mornings after a long night exploring! The rooftop deck offers a great view of the Empire State Building, which is a must-see. Another plus is the great location. We stayed here based off everyone's reviews about the great location, and were definitely pleased! There are subways literally steps away, which works out great. Macy's is very close, and the ESB is just around the corner! The pizza place on the corner like the other reviewer mentioned is a great place for a slice of pizza! The Hotel is on 35th st between 5th and 6th avenues, which makes it a little less loud than being, say, in times square, but offers enough traffic so you can easily catch a cab during the day. Overall, the location is definitely a major advantage, with it being close enough to everything you need and easy to navigate from! We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Metro, and as a first-time visitor to New York City, found the staff to be very helpful, and would highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent place to stay. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The rooms were spacious and clean. The front desk staff was very helpful. It was in an excellent location with a subway just down the street and a short walk to any shopping. I would stay here again with no question. The breakfast had everything you needed and places to eat was very close. This would be my hotel of choice anytime. I am a very picky person and this was a no brainer. The rooftop view of the Empire State Building was beautiful.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Apparently, this hotel used to be a bit tacky and run down. Well, evidently they have undergone some fairly recent renos, because this turned out to be a fantastic little find; a real gem of a hotel. You can’t beat the location, 35th and 6th, a subway stop right at the end of the street, walking distance to much, a block away from the Empire State Bldg., and only really ever a 10-15 minute cab or subway ride to anywhere else. We loved it!
reviews.title: Shhh, don't tell anyone how good this is, we'll never get back in!!!

likes.disliked: — New style minibars, you're not allowed to use the fridge to keep something you bought cold.

reviews.title: What a mistake!
reviews.text: Small, depressing rooms and an unhelpful staff (especially if you didn't book directly with the hotel). Made for a disappointing trip to NYC. Maybe some of the rooms are OK, but many (most?) are tiny and run down--see other reviews of the hotel. If you can stay anywhere else, don't take a chance on the Metro.

reviews.title: Hotel Metro 2-7th December 2004
reviews.text: Just got back after a 4 night stay at the Metro, it was our first visit and we had a fantastic time. I had read mix reviews but was very pleasantly suprised with the hotel. We had a large twin room with all the amenities, the only down side was that there were not tea making facilities in the room you had to go down to the breakfast room where it was available day and night, we also had a noisy fridge in the room but we coped with this we did soo much walking that made us soo tired we did not hear it during the night!!

reviews.title: Happy with Metro
reviews.text: Great location and we managed to do everything that we wanted to during our stay. The staff we extremely helpful they booked our trips for us and gave us money off vouchers for Macy's which was very well received and used!. I will certainly return to New York and would stay back at the Metro.

reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location
reviews.text: There were 4 of us women in 2 twin bedded rooms. Although our rooms were quite small they were very comfortable and clean. Our sheets and towels were changed daily and the staff were extremely helpful, even coming to our rescue when our shuttle back to the airport was delayed. Complementary breakfast every morning of beigels cream cheese and various muffins with coffee was a nice surprise. This was my first visit to NY. I'll definitely go back and I'll definitely be staying in Hotel Metro and would recommend it to anybody.

reviews.title: great little hotel
reviews.text: My friend & I spent Nov 18-21 in Manhattan, staying at the Hotel Metro (located on 34th street b/w 5th & 6th.) After doing MUCH research on where to stay that was reasonably priced (read lots of reviews), I choose this hotel and can honestly say that I was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel itself was clean, decorated well, centrally located and the staff was VERY friendly. We didn't spend that much time in the room as there is so much to do in NY but it was clean and comfortable and it had a refrigerator, which was a plus. The only negatives I have is that the bathroom shower was VERY narrow & hard to move in (we're petite girls)so if you are of a heavier set, it could cause quite a problem. The complimentary breakfast was OK - & the restaurant on site wasn't bad. The hotel itself is less than a block away from Macy's & other shops like Gap, Vicky's, Express, H&M, Steve Madden, Deane Pharmacy and more. It is 1 block away from the Empire State Bldg & about 6-8 blocks from Times Square. A couple of bars are located on the same street of the hotel as well as Subway, a Chinese place and nearby is McDonald's, Burger King & Wendy's. Around the corner on 35th street is Keene Steakhouse - which has excellent fillet, if you are looking for a very nice place to have dinner. Definitely recommend the hotel if you are looking for a reasonably priced place where you can lay your head down after a long day of being out and about on the town.

We stayed at the Metro from 20-24 Jan 2006 and had a fabulous time. Check in was quick and easy, the room, while not large was adequate for our needs. There was an in room fridge, plenty of wardrobe and drawer space and the heater was effective but quiet. the bed was really comfortable and when we asked reception for some extra pillows they arrived within minutes. The shower was excellent with really good water pressure and constant hot water. The room was cleaned and made up to a high standard every day
reviews.title: A graet hotel in a great location
Loved the Metro
reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast is really good, it is an 'all you can eat' buffet of cerals, toast, bagels, fresh fruit salad, yoghurt, pastries, croissants, tea coffee and juices and it really sets you up for the day. There is also complimentary tea and coffee served all day

reviews.title: Great hotel in a fantastic location
reviews.text: The location can not be beaten, 1 block from the ESB, 1 minute from Herad square and Maceys and a 5-10 minute walk to Times Square.
Thanks to all the staff at he Hotel Metro for a lovely stay at your hotel, we would defiantely return
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: I stayed at the Metro at the end of November 05 while on a 4 day shopping trip with my mother. The location of the hotel could not be better. One street away from the Empire State Building and Macy's just down the street.....Excellent! Also, with the subway literally a minute's walk away at the corner of the street, you could be at your next destination within minutes.
reviews.title: Good hotel, Great location!

reviews.text: Excellent location for my first trip to NYC, easy walk to Times Square and the Empire State Building. Friendly helpful staff. Room was rather smaller than expected but nicely decorated. The tub was very shallow and not comfortable if you like baths, but that's minor. Very good deal overall.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.text: We were budget conscious when booking the hotel and its services far exceeded my expectations. Its location was fantastic, close to all the attractions, and transport via the Metro is literally 30sec away. We had a quiet room (unbelievable in NY) and although the bed was a lilttle bit on the small side, we had a comfortable rest. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting decent accomodation in NY but don't want to pay the higher prices of the hotel chains.
reviews.title: Great quality for the budget minded traveller

reviews.text: We had read a lot of positive reviews in the internet, but were really surprised to see these reviews topped by our personal experience. The service at the reception was great and very helpful. We had at the first day a problem with our airco and the device was replaced within 1 hour.
reviews.title: right hotel at right location

reviews.text: Room was large and well eqipped, very clean, and had a large closet incl. safe, not common for hotels of this class in New York.

reviews.title: Good value
Fantastic hotel and great staff
reviews.text: My husband and I went to New York with my old school friend and her partner - originally we were going to celebrate mine and my friend's 50th birthdays - however our friends decided that whilst we were there they would get married at Central Park. From the day we arrived at the hotel we could not fault the service we got. The staff were absolutely great, especially James and Jetto, who helped us with the wedding arrangements. James recommend a restaurant for our friends wedding night and Jetto arranged for champagne and room upgrades (my daughter had e-mailed the hotel to let them know of our friends wedding). The hotel was very clean and the rooms were comfortable. Breakfast was out of this world - large muffins, bagels which were out of this world, fresh fruit, cereals, fruit juices and tea/coffee - tea and coffee were available all day. There was a sun terrace you could go to and the bar was open there in the evening. Location could not have been better - we were 2 minutes from Maceys which my friend and I made the most of and visited there every day - 5 minutes from Empire State Building (make sure you go at night - view breathtaking) - 10 minutes from Time Square and 2 seconds from Metro. The people in New York were so friendly. The wedding in Central Park was fantastic and everything went without a hitch. We would also most certainly go back again and in fact have made a pact to go back in 5 years time to celebrate our friends anniversary.

I will say that the hotel was nice. The only thing negative I have to say is that the neighborhood around the hotel leaves something to be desired. We arrived from Penn Station about 9PM. We walked about 3 blocks to the hotel. On the block that the hotel is located, there are several small restaurants. Each of these restaurants had put out their trash for pickup right about the time we arrived. Not only was there about 100 plastic bags of trash, the smell was tremendous. There is enough foot traffic at that hour so that I didn't feel unsafe. Macy's is right down the street as well as major subway and bus lines. And of course, Penn Station. I stayed here one night because of its proximity to Penn Station and the LIRR/Airtrain to JFK airport. The trip to the airport using the public transportation was $10. By cab, it would have cost over $50 with tip. The city caps cab fares but only from the airport to Manhattan. Going to the airport, it's "let the buyer beware". Would stay again.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel
Excellent location, fantastic price!
reviews.text: Very impressed with this hotel given the price. We were expecting to have to sacrifice on some leve of comfort from previous hotels on our trip, but we were pleasantly surprised. Complimentary breakfast, and Wi-Fi in the rooms was an excellent help to us, and the staff were immensley helpful in sorting out early issues that we had with the Wi-Fi.
The roof top terrace is an excellent place to sit with a few drinks in the evening, for romantic couples, right up to businessmen winding down after a hard day at work.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: I'm certainly staying here again for my winter shopping trips, as well as on my next busiess trip, there is simply no reason to pay any extra money for hotels of similar, or in many cases worse quality.
reviews.title: Wouldn't Stay Here Again

reviews.text: We booked the 2 bedroom family suite for 5 nights. The 2 bed family suite contains 2 twin beds in one room and 1 queen bed in a seperate room. There were 4 adults traveling in the group. I contacted the reservations department to see if this room would accomate 4 adults as the max amount of prople allowed to stay in this room according to there website was 2 which i found strange as it was a 2 bedroom suite. The reservations department confirmed the price for 4 adults sharing the 2 bedroom suite and we booked it. Appon arrival at the hotel when we checked in we were told that there would be an extra charge per person per night beacause there were 4 adults staying in the suite. We told them that when making the reservation we were told that the room could accomadte 4 adults at the price comfirmed on the internet and we weren't told about any extra charges. The girl at reception told us that we would have to talk to the reservations manager the next morning to sort the problem out and i agreed to come down at 9 the next morning to talk to him. When i arrived down at reception there was another girl on duty and i asked for the reservations manager as planned and was asked what the problem was. After explaining the problem all over again, i was told that i would have to talk to the manager over the phone as he was to busy to talk to me directly. I was then told to come back later that day to talk to him on the phone. When i retutrned i was told by the same girl that i couldn't talk to him and that she had explained the problem to him and he said we had to pay extra. We had to end up paying the extra as we had nowhere else to go. I was mad that they didn't want me talking to the manager and i say by there attidue that they didn't even bother to talk to him. The hotel was lovely and location was great but due to an error on there behalf that left us paying extra i wouldn't stay there again. Just be aware of all extra costs when booking your room!
reviews.title: Disapointed with treatment

reviews.text: we stayed in the hotel for 4 nights,excellent location,times square,broadway,macys,subway at end of street.coffee on tap,good continental breakfast,found the staff very friendly+helpful,and always a smile and a good morning from the maids.bedding changed daily with fresh towels and shampoos etc.the room we booked had 2 queen sized beds and a seperate bedroom with queen bed and cupboard with safe, loads of room no problem storing 6 suitcases and 6 pieces of hand luggage and that was for only 3 people would highly recomend this hotel.
reviews.title: great

reviews.text: I booked a room at the Metro based on all the good reviews it has received. Whilst I agree that the hotel is in a good location and the rooms are very clean, I am shocked that nobody has commented on the ridiculously small size of the rooms.
reviews.title: Couldnt swing a cat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was so small that the bathroom door couldnt open more than half way as it hit against the bed. I also had to put my suitcase at the side of the bed as there was nowhere else I could put it so I couldnt get in the bed from that side.
reviews.title: Hotel let down by staff, totally lacking in enthusiasm
metro and new york spot on!!!
reviews.text: I also couldnt sleep properly as the air conditioning was really loud.

We stayed at the Hotel Metro for 5 nights from 28th Oct. We booked with Virgin in the UK and also pre-booked all our excursions. We had 2 'Superior ' rooms on the 2nd floor, one for my husband and I, and one for our teenage daughters. Both rooms were a decent size, well furnished with comfy double beds and well equipped bathrooms. There was plenty of hot water and the shower was very powerful. The towels were changed daily and the toiletries replaced. The rooms were up only one flight of stairs so we never had to use the lifts, other than to go and check out the roof top terrace/bar which gave a very close up view of the Empire State Building.
reviews.title: Good Value

likes.liked: — The breakfast included in the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem with one of the rooms was that it was on the front of the hotel and the noise from 3.00am, on the street ,was horrendous eg collection of garbage, deliveries etc. If possible request a room at the back of the hotel, the only noise our daughters heard was the hum from an outside air-con unit.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The reception staff/concierge were very friendly and helpful ,always enquiring if we needed any directions etc. The breakfast was also very good with enough choice to get you well fed before venturing out. We liked the informal lounge where you sat to eat it. Coffee/Tea was available free at any time.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.text: The hotel was quite well placed for all the sights particularly the ESB and Maceys. Go to the ESB at night if you can, there's hardly any queues but remember to take some ID with you - they prefer it if you've got a photocopy of your passport.
reviews.title: A very well located clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having pre-booked all our sightseeing/excursion tickets before we travelled we were very pleased to find these waiting for us at the hotel when we arrived. I would recommend doing this if you want to do a Helicopter Flight or a trip to Niagra which we did. One word of warning though - the Niagra trip (by air) is a very long day - pick up at 6.15am arrive back at the hotel at 10.30pm. Having said that, its a great trip and very quiet at this time of year. The Maid of the Mist ride finishes on the 24th Oct so we were disappointed to miss this as the Virgin rep had said it ran until 31st Oct.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — It's a tie between the cleanliness of the room and the hotel's close proximity to the Garden.

reviews.text: Very impressed with this Hotel. Excellent location handy for the subway system and five minutes from the ESB.

reviews.title: Great location for sightseeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For my daughter's Birthday my sister and I bought tickets to see Wicked and thought it would be fun to make it an overnight trip. I found this hotel and thought the reviews and pictured sounded and looked great! I was right. The hotel was in a great location, walking distance from Grand Central, Times Square and fun 5th Avenue shopping. The front desk staff and doormen were very friendly. We arrived early, about 10:30am and even though our room wasn't ready, check in was at 4, we checked our luggage and then were told if we wanted to sit and have some juice or snacks breakfast was still being served in the lounge area. This was nice as we were able to take a few minutes to make a plan for ourselves! When we returned later we got the keys to our room and headed up. We had booked the 2 bedroom premier family room and it was wonderful! So clean and large, I'm sure we could have got away with just the double double room, but this was totally worth the extra money. The complimentary water and soda was much appreciated and the high end toiletries were nice as well. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were quiet and dark, which was nice for sleeping in the next morning. The only thing which would have been nice was if the roof top bar stayed open later then 10. Breakfast the next morning had a nice selection of bagels, muffins, yogurt. When my daughter went to get orange juice it was empty, but was quickly filled and the attendent brought her a cup to the table. Check out was at 12 and the staff was very friendly then as well. we checked our bags again and enjoyed a few more hours shopping and sightseeing. I would definitely reccomned Hotel Metro, and we stay there again on future visits!
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel without any previous knowledge. Fantastic location for sightseeing - only a block or so from 5th Avenue and Empire State. The roof terrace with its own bar was a definite first port of call after a day sightseeing. Self-serve continental breakfast which worked very well. Food available in the ground floor bar from lunchtimes. Good quality as well as fair prices. Would definitely go back if we return to NY.
reviews.title: Great view from the terrace, and nice hotel

reviews.text: I'm sorry if this review looks long but we had such a good time here I want every one to know how great it was. As this hotel was fantastic. I have recently got back from New York with my boyfriend. We were there for 5 nights from 3rd dec to 8th dec and had an absolutely superb time here.
reviews.title: Wow! Right in the centre of NYC. Excellent hotel.
Great
reviews.text: From the moment we stepped off the plane the people were so friendly. This made us feel very welcome and completely at ease.

We took the New Jersey transit train from Newark airport to Penn station which is known to be faster to get in to the city than taxis and air shuttles. Only took around 20 minutes and cost $14 each. Then from Penn station it is only a 5 minute walk to the hotel, not worth getting a taxi, and you will not look out of place with a suitcase as not many people care. They are busy going about their own business!
reviews.title: Loved the Metro

reviews.text: When we got into the hotel the guy on the desk was really friendly as were all the people in the hotel. The room wasn't huge but you won't need it to be any bigger if you're here for shopping and sight seeing. There is a fantastic roof terrace which is open all year round but the bar on the roof is only open in the summer. You will have a fantastic view of the Empire State building where you will get superb views.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Excellent Location
Ideal location
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was also a great bonus as it means you can fill up before doing the sights without worring about where to eat. The breakfast was a choice of cereals, gorgeous bagels, toast, fruit salad, yogurts, fruit juices, muffins the size of your hand, pastries, fruit and tea and coffee. You will definately be filled up by the breakfast as you can eat as much as you like.

I have just spent 5 days at the Hotel Metro with my 16 year old daugher and her friend. The location of the hotel was excellent for both sightseeing and shopping. We could walk everywhere we wanted to go. - Times Square 10 mins, 5th Avenue Shopping 15 mins, Empire State Building 2 mins! The room was very clean and had everything you could ask for, hairdryer, tv, minibar, iron and very comfortable beds. Breakfast was included and this was a great bonus as it meant we didn't have to look for somewhere to eat each morning. There was huge selection of muffins, bagels, cereals - in fact everything you could ask for. The hotel bar was very welcoming, food there was great too. Staff couldn't have been more helpful. I would recommend this hotel as an excellent choice for a short break. One tip though, ask for a room at the back of the hotel, ours was at the back and although there was no view, we also didn't have to listen to the traffic all night! I imagine rooms at the front could be a bit noisy.
reviews.title: Great location, very friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel fitted the bill perfectly. Brilliant location, could not have asked for more. Quiet, clean and polite. Room size not huge but then we weren't booking the Plaza and it was to sleep in, not move into! Good breakfast and open from 6.30 til 11 which is great (although gets very busy at certain times) and 24 hour tea and coffee. We were there to see the sights, and this hotel made that really easy. The front desk were really helpful when it came to leaving for the airport. The only annoying thing was we tended to break our day by returning to the hotel and they stripped the rooms in the morning and serviced in the afternoon so the beds werent remade when we came back. However, we never asked for it to be done and the maid said we could specify a time at the front desk if we wished so our own fault really. I knew that NY hotels were really pricey for what you get but this hotel I thought was perfect value for money, not a feeling I get often from hotels! We were lucky as we saw this on Trip Advisor and Virgin were having a deal at the time we went so this added to the value.
reviews.title: Perfect for the occasion
Not outstanding, but location is excellent
reviews.text: Nothing outstanding, but fine overall. The location is excellent, and the room is tiny, but clean and quiet. The breakfast buffet is fine as well - not outstanding, not terrible. Service is brusque; this was one area that I felt could be improved. Overall, for the price (I paid around $300.night for a weekend in October) it's a good value, because of the location. It's difficult to find something in NYC that's any cheaper and also in a decent location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple

reviews.text: As stated many times - its biggest plus is its location and its biggest minus is the size of some of the bedrooms. If moving around space is important to you, don't stay here. We had a king room which looked out into the building well, so it was always gloomy in the room. However, it also meant it was quiet as we could hear no street noise apart from sirens.
reviews.title: OK hotel, nothing special...
Excellent!
reviews.text: We stayed here for 6 nights & had a great stay!

When we booked the hotel we stated that it was a birthday celebration & that a view of the Empire State Building would be appreciated. This was duly met, along with a small box of chocolates & a message on our phone. We'd stayed in Las Vegas & Toronto before NYC & this was the first hotel to make any concession- well done!
reviews.title: Right smack bang in the middle of Manhattan

likes.disliked: — Paying for a parcel to be stored until I came, they charged me $20

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is clean & modern, & whilst I wouldn't describe it as luxurious it is more than comfortable. The room was clean & equipped with plenty of storage, an iron & board, hair dryer & in-room safe, everything we needed. The free breakfast was very good & the staff were polite & unfailingly helpul. There is a gym on the top floor, along with a roof terrace, which although isn't really usable in December, is a great vantage point for photos of the ESB.
reviews.title: A Great First Time In NYC At The Metro

likes.disliked: — WAITING FOR ELEVATORS - BUT THEY ARE RENOVATING HOTEL!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best plus point is the location- Broadway, Macys & a subway at one end of the street, Fifth Avenue, the ESB & buses to up & down town at the other, add to that the bars & restaurants within easy walking distance & the location was perfect for us!
reviews.title: Great Small Hotel
Excellent location; decent hotel
reviews.text: I would really recommend this hotel & would use it whenever in NYC!

My sister and I stayed at The Metro for a 5 day stay in NYC and loved it. It is in an ideal location (5 minute walk to the Empire State Building and 3 minute walk to Macys!), with fantastic views of the Empire State Building and of NYC in general.
reviews.title: Great, little hotel in a FANTASTIC location

reviews.title: Very nice hôtel well located !

likes.liked: — Terrasse on the roof, very close to subway, breakfast included, free internet

reviews.text: Breakfast was perfect with a selection of hot/cold beverages and a great choice of bagels and muffins etc.

reviews.text: The room was spotless and, although a little small, was perfect for all we needed it for. NYC is such a fantastic city with so much to do that you'll hardly need to sleep :)

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at the hotel Metro, this was our pre-honeymoon trip.
reviews.title: 3 Alaskans loved the Hotel Metro!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited NYC in February 2012 with my Boyfriend. Hotel staff where very friendly and welcoming, which was refreshing after a long and exhausting plane journey. Room was a good size, with all the latest mod-cons; flat screen TV, alarm with Ipod docking station, built in safe, free internet, hairdryer etc... I was unable to work the safe on arrival, i called down to reception and they tol me an engineer would be up to be as soon as possible. Within 60 seconds of making the call, an engineer was at my room to assist me, which demonstrates the excellent customer service that you recieve that this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in a Wonderful City!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Continental breakfast is outstanding with a vast array of cerials, bagels, muffins, fruit and more and we never struggled for anywhere to sit on a morning.
reviews.title: Great home base for first time in the city

reviews.text: Although it was too cold for the roof-top bar to be open when we visited in March, we did pop up there and it looked fantastic. You get the most fantasic view of the empire state ever, ad i would imagine that in the summer this terrace is lovely to sit and relax in.
reviews.title: Brilliant place to stay

reviews.text: As for location- this could not be faulted at all. You are pretty much opposite Macy's and in the next block to the empire state. Times square is easily accessible on foot, taking no more tha 10 minutes to reach and the fFatiron and Madison Square Garden are also within easy walking distance. For the city that never sleeps- you can sleep soundly in this hotel and I would recommend to anyone who wants to visit NYC...!
reviews.title: Hotel metro fantastic location

reviews.text: My husband and I came to New York City for our anniversary weekend. The location is so convenient due to being literally just a few steps from the subway station (34th Herald Square) which will take you anywhere in the city. It is also about a 10-15 min leisurely walk to Times Square or one subway station away.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Minor gripes were lack of coathangers and lack of shelf space in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The free breakfast was fine I thought although my husband was disappointed there was no option for a cooked breakfast. I didn't like the disposable cutlery and crockery though - that's not helping the global warming situation!

Great places to eat out and we would highly recommend the Oyster Bar at Grand Central Terminal and for a real romantic treat try the World Yacht fine dining cruise around Manhatten Bay at night (WOW).

reviews.text: Walking distance to great places to eat, theatres and bars as well as shopping and sightseeing. As two young female travellers felt safe returning at night in surrounding streets.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 rd time to new york and i nead to say this is the best hotel iv stayed in. The 1st time in new york i stayed in a top well known hotel and hotel metro can do the same things as them but beter the bed and pillows wer the best iv ever had so all ways get a good nights sleep the shower was grate as the rest of the room the room was clean with a free safe to keep all your bits in staff wer verry good and frendly mid town on 35th sreet west and 5th and 6th st 5 min walk to time squre 5min walk to penn train station so gate to get to from newick and jfk we will be comeing back to new york next year and will be staying at the hotel metro a big thank you to all tha staff at the metro for makeing are stay the best wev had in new york we will allways stay at the mero from now on PS the A/CON WAS AS COLD AS YOU LIKE THAT WAS GRATE
reviews.title: best place to stay in new york

reviews.text: This was our 2nd visit to new york and we stayed in the metro the 1st time we had to stay there again. Excellent helpful staff,smart clean and comfortable room. We went from the 17th/23 aug for my wifes 30th birthaday i emailed the hotel stating this and they were kind enough to leave a lovely ice cooled bottle of wine for us a gift. We had 1 slight problem with the air-con but within 20 minutes the maintenance guy had sorted it no problems after that. Breakfast is great,great muffins nice bagels fresh fruit could have not have been better. A couple of restaraunts was a beautiful steakhouse called Keens on 36th i had the biggest T-Bone steak i have ever seen and my wife had lamb chops and they were both outstanding. It is a little pricey but well worth. To get around the city we brought a 48hr hop on hop off open top bus ticket this is a must to see the sights and get to know the location the company was new york sightseeing tours they have people dotted around the city dressed in red t-shirts and coats. You also got a bus trip to brooklyn and a harbour with the 48hr tickets so i would highly recommend the 48hr service. A night on the town tour was a great time to spend 6 hrs going on a water taxi and little italy for a meal and then finishing at the rockefeller centre. Amazing views espically at night. The hotel has the perfect location to reach everthing so easily we will be going again and the metro is the place for us to stay.
reviews.title: The perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great hotel in an excellent location, a 5 minute walk to the Empire, a 2 minute walk to Macys and a subway station a stones throw away. Me and my husband stayed here in January and had just the best time. The hotel is small, and is very well maintained, I must admit that our view wasn't the best (looking out to a brick wall) however you do not go to Manhattan to stay in your hotel room do you?! A light breakfast is included serving bagels and muffins, fruit juice tea and coffee etc. If you're cheeky enough, sneak a muffin to have with your afternoon coffee which is freely available.I will definitely stay at the Hotel Metro when I return to New York.
reviews.title: Excellent location and super muffins for breakfast!

reviews.text: Stayed here for one week in August and the location was just perfect. We caught the Train from JFK to Jamaica and then switched to the Subway line to Penn Station, easy and cheap! Also bought a $29 7 day unlimited metro card and travelled everywhere on the subway, from Harlem, Bronx to Brooklyn etc. The hotel was easy walking distance to Empire State, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller, Macy's. It's clean and comfortable, room was a little small but hey it's NYC! The roof terrace was nice if a little pricy! Staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great central Manhattan location!

reviews.text: As always, I had a fantastic experience at the Hotel Metro. My room was delightful-beautiful,clean, comfortable and loaded with all the extras. A safe in the room, free internet, large flat screen TV, refrigerator ...we didn't want to leave our room!! I love the staff, always available and quick to help. The continenal breakfast is such a nice feature-bagels, muffins, yogurt, fresh fruit, coffee, OJ, and tea. The location is perfect-right next to the Empire State Builiding and a block from the largest Macy's in the world. We were able to walk to the theater and Times Squares comfortably in minutes. Great restaurants and shopping close by. And to top it off, they have the Metro Grill where you can have a nice dinner and drinks after a busy day in the city. And the rooftop terrace! With amazing views of the Empire State Building-it is always open (and so pretty at night) and serves drinks from 5pm-10pm. I can't say enough! I have traveled to NYC many times, and I always stay at the Hotel Metro.
reviews.title: Favorite hotel in NYC

reviews.text: I just returned from a first time trip to NYC and I have to rave about our hotel. The Hotel Metro was an excellent choice for a first-timer in the city. The location was excellent ... right around the corner from the Empire State Building, a short walk from Herald Square where one can find Macy's, Sephora, Victoria's Secret and tons of other stores. Half a street block away from a subway station that connects with all the major lines that can take you almost anywhere very quickly.
reviews.title: Great Find!!

reviews.text: The room itself was quite spacious and we had a great view of the Empire State Building. The continental breakfast was perfect to fill up on before a day out in the city. Lots to choose from and plenty of room to sit and enjoy it. The staff was friendly and always available to hail a cab or give a suggestion as to where to eat or what to see.
reviews.title: Quiet hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommmend this hotel to anybody who is a first time visitor and is overwhelmed with all the choices out there.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel.

likes.liked: — Location, location, breakfast and tea and coffee facilities

reviews.title: What a surprise!
reviews.text: Staying at the Metro was a highlight of my recent five-night trip to New York. I was there during an unusual spring snowstorm. However, the location of the Metro was perfect. It was near the Empire State Building and within walking distance of the theater district. The hotel had a wonderful breakfast every morning, which kept overall expenses low. I requested a quiet room on an upper floor. My room was larger than I expected with a roomy closet. It was very clean and quiet. I look forward to going back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from a magnificnet holiday to NYC. This hotel is excellent. Location, location, location alone makes this hotel a number 1 choice. The room was big enough for our stay. People say the rooms were small, but your only sleeping there and we never felt cramped at all. There are no difference in size of horel room from when we have stayed in London. We were on the 5th floor at the back of the hotel. We are pleased that we did. No view from the room, but to be honest all the buildings in the area are the same size or bigger. I cant really see what view you could have. I would recommend staying at the back of the hotel, due to the street noise with the forever beeping horns from cars. 5 min walk to Empire State, under 5 mins to Macy's, 10-15 mins walk to Times Square. Breakfast was great and had a lovely area to eat in or to relax after a long day. Tea and coffee 24/7. Staff friendly and helpful. Definately recommend this hotel. I cant wait to go back.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Wonderful Location........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and would definately stay again if we were to travel to New York. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the rooms were clean (although avoid the one's at the front of the street as it can be noisy at night!).
reviews.title: Great location for seeing New York

reviews.text: For sightseeing - it is a few blocks away from Times Square and Broadway, one block away from Macy's and a short walk to the Rockafella Centre. The rooftop bar has a great view of the Empire State Building.
reviews.title: Will by my top choice when I return to NYC

likes.liked: — Service, room size, free breakfast, roofdeck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was basic but there is sufficient choice to keep you going for a few hours doing the tourist bit!
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.text: I stayed here with two friends on a Saturday night. First things first - I was blown away by the service at this hotel. George at the front desk was exceptional.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We showed up early to check-in and he happily stored our luggage, lent me an umbrella (it was pouring), and gave us several restaurant recommendations and a discount card for a nearby pub. He then helped us map out all of the spots we wanted to see that afternoon and told us the best way to get to them.
reviews.title: Metro New York
Average - Needs a renovation
reviews.text: This is an average hotel for NYC. The location is great and there are some good restaurants right next door, try the Korean places to the right of the entrance. However, the hotel is in need of a renovation. The couches in the lobby all have torn fabric and are straight out of the 80s. The rooms are small and are in desperate need of a renovation as well. The bathroom was tiny and the shower/bath was stained from years of use. Overall, it was pretty clean, though our room wasn't serviced until after 5pm.
It's not a bad hotel overall, especially for the price. I would recommend somewhere else though if you want something really nice for a little bit more.
reviews.title: Great location
Great location, great staff
reviews.text: Stayed at Hotel Metro from Dec 19 to 22 2005. Like most people we chose this hotel because of Tripadvisor reviews and couldn't have been happier. We have teens aged 15 and 17 so had requested interconnecting rooms which we were given. Although the twin room was bigger both it and the double room were a great size, with plenty of room for a dresser, large bedside tables plus a fridge and a table and two chairs. Bathrooms were very clean with huge showers. The decor was very art deco. As we were only on the third floor bit noisy at night but then this city really never sleeps! The complimentary breakfast was a great bonus and the public areas all very nice. We had tickets for NY Rangers ice hockey at MSG and Spamalot and both were within a 5-10 minute walk, as was Empire State Building and our favourite shop Macys. Would definitely stay here again!

We were in NYC during the transit strike. The Hotel Metro turned out to be the best location for going uptown and downtown. Travelled w/ husband and 17 and 19 year old kids. Got the family suite. A little pricey but
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Metro!

reviews.text: NYC is pricey. Great to have a breakfast right there so we Floridians didn't need to freeze our buns off to get a cup of coffee or cocoa in the morning. The doorman is worthy of extra praise and a big tip when you leave. He was pleasant, helpful and kind. They gave us room 1002 and one room had a view of Herald Square and the lights at Macy's and the other room had a view of the Empire State building. NYC tips- I emailed MTV several months prior to arrival and got my kids tix to be in the audience. At Christmas they give all audience members a free gift. They got new digital cameras. Within walking distance (15 minutes) on 2nd ave and 35th is a diner called the Gemini Diner. I read a review on menu pages and thought we'd check it out. My kids could care less about fancy restaurants and I hate chains. It was reasonable priced , had awesome food and a huge selection. And homemade desserts. We walked alot, spent alot but had a fantastic time.
reviews.title: Fab Fab Fab
Fab Hotel
reviews.text: First time in New York and we stayed at the Hotel Metro. Really centralised and from our room we could see Macy's. The room was a decent size and clean although the bathroom was a bit on the small side. There isn't any tea/coffee facilities in the room although you can get tea/coffee from the dining area 24 hrs a day. The breakfast is good: cereals, toast, muffins, croissants etc - enough to keep you going. Very comfortable dining area with two televisions. The staff at the hotel are very pleasant and helpful. They are happy to help you with working out the subway stops and recommending restaurants - try Phinos Italian restaurant - it's great! Unfortunately the rooftop terrace was closed for repairs so we didn't get to go up there which was a shame. We throughly enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay again. It's situated in a great place close to the shops and the Empire State Building. It's about a 15-20 min walk to the Rockefeller Centre and Times Square. We would definitely recommend a stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally booked into another hotel nearby because others in our party were staying there but, having read its reviews on this site, contacted our travel agent to swap our booking to the Metro. Admittedly it cost a little more than our original one but it was well worth the extra. The hotel staff were efficient and friendly, the rooms were very comfortable and we loved the Art Deco decor. The breakfast is great if you can resist doing the true american pancakes experience (which we only managed twice during our stay!). Having seen the rooms where others in our party were staying, we definitely made the right choice.
reviews.title: Thankyou Tripadvisor!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its also worth noting that the hotel will arrange airport transfers for you if you need them.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location at reasonable price (for New York)

reviews.text: There's also a great Irish bar a few doors down which had a great atmosphere.
reviews.title: Loved It--Priced Out of It Today
Nice small hotel at a nice price
reviews.text: Excellent location in Mid Manhattan. Staff very helpful and friendly. We had a delux room which was quite large with two beds, although the bathroom was very small (but you dont spend much time in there). Breakfast was fantasic with a really good choice of bagels, cereals, pastries, Muffins, toast and yogurts, enough to set you up for a day of sightseeing. The roof top terrace is well worth a look, although it can be a little cool and windy. The hotel also has free internet access and a gym, although we didn't make any use of these facilities. I would definitley stay here again!

We picked this hotel with location and price in mind and were not disappointed. For those with the same intentions this hotel was great. Additionally, the staff was great and was quick to respond to any problems and did so in an appropriate manor. The breakfast is included and is something substantial. We would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
Hotel Metro - a fantastic place
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Metro for 5 nights at the start of December and couldn't fault any of our stay. Right from our arrival to our departure, the staff were great and the service was brilliant. The room we had was just a standard room, but catered for all our needs and was very clean, with the linen and towels changed everyday. The breakfasts in the morning are served from 6am until 11am so plenty of time to stock up on the delicious muffins, bagels, toast, yoghurt and fresh fruit. Tea and coffee is on tap free of charge 24 hours a day, just the trick when you've come in from a hard days shopping and hectic sightseeing, to give you the boost for the nighttime. The location of the hotel is ideal, within walking distance of Macy's, Broadway, Empire State Building, Central Park to name but a few. Am planning on going back to NY in a couple of years and will certailny stay there again.

Walked from Grand Central to the Metro - found it easy to find, and the art deco bright neon sign was nice and set the tone for the hotel. Check in was quick, the room was very nicely appointed, if small (as I expected). Looked like it had recently been redone, and the linens and pillows made it feel like it was a more upscale hotel. No complaints at ALL about the room. The lobby and breakfast room were also very nice, and art deco styled -- felt very "New York." And there's a very good free breakfast, and free coffee or tea anytime, day or night.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay at the Metro

likes.liked: — Nice, newly renovated clean rooms, free breakfast, unbeatable location
likes.disliked: — Doorman who wouldn't open the door, staff was adequate, but nothing special

reviews.text: The lowest point of the hotel is the staff. The doorman regularly would not even attempt to help us with the door, even when we arrived back with large Christmas gifts! The front desk staff were adequate, but one time they continued their conversation well after I'd walked up to the counter. But they recommended a great restaurant -- Brendan's -- so I give them kudos for that!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!
Great Location, Good Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here last month and it was perfect! Good location near Subway and walking distance to Bryant Park and Grand Central Terminal(gorgeous!). We live in Atlanta and were worried about not having enough "space" Their rooftop bar (closed in the winter but still available) was a perfect refuge for an evening cocktail brought from the room and then out to dinner or room service from the Metro Grill. HUGE portions and pretty good- very good if you've been walking all day. Can't beat the continental breakfast- it's free and you get it before you get ready for the day. Can't say enough about the rooftop- where else in Manhattan can you have 550 square feet to just a few people. Oh, and the windows in the bathroom open to fresh air.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just the most fantastic location, out of the hotel turn right 500 metres down the street and Macy's is right infront of you, Turn left 500 metres down the st and your on 5th Avenue - this hotel cannot be any better placed.
reviews.title: Great Loacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is lovely, staff nice and breakfast filling. The rooms are of good standard, if you have the luxury of staying on a high or top floor you can see the empire state building in your view. The decor is a little dated but not as bad as some hotels in NY.
reviews.title: Juat what we wnted

reviews.text: Would definitely recommend especially for those first timers in NY.
reviews.title: Bed linens weren't 100% cotton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Metro during the first week of April, taking a vacation and a shopping trip for the "better half". Well, there can not be a lot to add to all the previously positive comments, only to say that I agree totally and the hotel is a great find for NY. For what you pay and what you get, with the room, hotel and staff, it is exceptional value and we will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: What can you add!!!

reviews.text: The hotel is located in a great position between 5th and 6th Avenue and is easy to access from Newark Airport. We caught the train from the airport to NY Penn, which took about 30 minutes and cost $15, then walked for 10 minutes to the hotel from the station. The walk is easy and on the way you pass the shops and Madison Square Gardens, if it’s a sunny day you also get a great initial view of the ESB! The hotel is five minutes from Macy's one way and five minutes from the shops of 5th Avenue the other. It takes about 10 - 15 minutes to walk to Times Square and subway access is just at the end of the street.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We stayed in Hotel Metro for 7 nights at the end of July/start of August. On arrival we were early before check in however one room was ready so after a lengthy flight we were happy to sit in the room and wait. The staff were very helpful and the concierge helped us throughout our stay booking restaurants and giving advice.
reviews.title: Small Rooms but fantastic location!

reviews.text: The rooms were very clean; maid service and clean towels everyday. The rooms although they were small, the hotel was perfectly situated within walking distance to most attractions. The air conditioning was loud but easily slept through, as it was essential during the summer! The roof top bar did have a spectacular view of the empire state building, perfect for a drink after a long day.
reviews.title: Great location. Great breakfast. Large rooms. Wonderful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used a bus tour which was good fun, and we would recommend the breakfasts at the hotel, fresh bagels everyday were lovely!
reviews.title: Nice '40s-style hotel in Manhattan's mid 30s

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommendations of things to do in New York, the ricksaw round central park was fantastic, but bargain them down, we managed to get it down to $75 dollars for 2, also taxis averaged out cheaper than we realised, working out about $6/7 dollars for a trip uptown or downtown.
reviews.title: Small room, but GREAT hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was the perfect place to rest your head after a long tiring day of walking round the city. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: 1st time in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Metro for 6 nights in August. We had booked it because of the good reviews on Tripadvisor. We had spent a long time trying to decide where to stay. But we are very happy we made this decision.
reviews.title: Will stay there again

reviews.text: We requested a room on the higher floors and got one just below the rooftop and it was really nice. I think it was a new room. My husband also told them it was my birthday and they had left some chocolates in the room. This hotel is great value for money. The breakfast is good. You get tea, coffee, fruit, bagels, toast, pastries and muffins. Enough to last you until lunchtime!
reviews.title: Great for the price!

likes.liked: — Good location, relatively inexpensive with nice benefits
likes.disliked: — just a little bit out of the way and not the absolute nicest place ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great too! It’s got Fifth Avenue on one side and Macy’s on the other. Times Square is only 5 minutes away. I definitely recommend doing the bus hop-on-hop-off thing. As you get unlimited rides for 72 hours we used the bus to go downtown for dinner as well. Saved us on paying for the underground or a taxi.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was one girl in reception who was a bit moody but the rest were helpful enough. I also used the beauty salon and the lady who runs it is really lovely. I had to wait for my nail polish to dry and she told me lots about her life in America. She’s originally from Romania.
reviews.title: Another great review

reviews.text: Also opposite the hotel a bit further down towards Fifth Avenue, there is a delicatessen store run by a Korean woman. At the back there is a little restaurant type thing which is amazing. My husband and I have lived in Hong Kong and are usually really fussy about our Chinese food but this was really good.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.text: Found staff to be pleasant and helpful. Excellent location. Room spacious and very clean, but front facing rooms can be noisy. 24 hour coffee a great bonus! Would return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Pre-Christmas visit to the Big Apple.
Fabulous hotel; would stay there again!
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to stay at the Hotel Metro during our recent December trip to NYC. We were more than happy with the hotel, and would highly recommend this hotel to others. In October we stated at a W hotel in NYC and preferred the Metro, which was also less expensive for a better room.

Check-in at the hotel was seamless, and though we booked online through the hotel's website there was no problem with our reservation. In fact, they even upgraded us for free to a better room, for no apparent reason. The room we ended up with was fabulous--huge (the size of my entire apartment), with a nice bathroom and plenty of closet space. For what we were paying we were very pleased. Everything was clean and spotless and the maid service was excellent.
reviews.title: CENTRAL

reviews.text: We also liked the intimate feel of the Metro, over more impersonal hotels like the major chains.
reviews.title: loved the Metro

reviews.text: We didn't have much interaction with the staff, though they did stow our luggage on the last day because we had a late flight and there was no problem with this. We enjoyed the free continental breakfast, and ate onc breakfast in the adjoining hotel restaurant, which was good and inexpensive, though the service was painfully slow.
reviews.title: first time in NY
